job_description:
• Candidates must be enrolled in an Associate of Applied Science (AAS) program in Mechatronics, Robotics, Engineering Technology, or a closely related field, with an expected graduation date of December 2026 or later.
• Qualification procedures in a cleanroom manufacturing environment.
• Complete required safety training and conduct all work in accordance with safety policies.
• Encouraged completion of degree between December 2026 and August 2027 Knowledge of AC/DC circuits and basic fundamentals of electricity.
• Intermediate PC skills Less than 2 years Relocating to Manassas, VA to complete a 3-month internship.
• OJT on preventative/corrective maintenance and equipment.
• Improve equipment availability by investigating chronic tool problems and finding solutions.
• Mechanical proficiency with the ability to understand and troubleshoot mechanical systems.

• General knowledge of PLC and SCADA systems, electrical systems, MCC, AFD, UPS, understanding of other facility systems such as UPW, IWTP, acid exhaust, CDA, scrubbers, etc Proficiency in using electrical testing tools and diagnostic equipment: Experience using Volt/Ohm meter, Fluke 744, 754, and/or Beamex MC6 Documenting Process Calibrators and related components.
• Proficient computer skills including spreadsheets and PowerPoint Manage and supervise the installation of new equipment, Participate in continuous improvement and reliability initiatives.
• Suggest and perform upgrade of obsolete equipment 2+ years of industrial equipment experience in facility maintenance or industrial setting, Understanding of semiconductor equipment and processes Perform required calibrations of all site analyzers, and monitoring devices to ISO standards.
• Pressure, temperature, pH, flow, humidity Flexibility to work occasional weekends, evenings, or on-call shifts as needed Experience in data extraction, analysis, and reporting CCST Certification Less than 2 years.
• Strong knowledge of electrical codes, standards, and safety protocols with the ability to read and interpret technical documents, blueprints, and schematics.

• Join our 30,000 everyday heroes.
• A global technology and professional services company that delivers consulting, technology and mission services to every major agency across the U.
• Government, defense and intelligence community.
• Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation.
• We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development.
• Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.
• For more information about GDIT's Privacy Policy, click here: https://www.
• Com/privacy-policy/notices/.
